alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 10 at 5:15PM AKST until January 10 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Visibility reduced to one quarter mile or less at times. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. East to southeast winds gusting 25 to 40 mph. Freezing Rain with ice accumulations up to a glaze. * WHERE...Nunivak Island and the Kuskokwim Delta Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Widespread blowing snow will produce white-out conditions at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blizzard conditions are winding down along the Kuskokwim Delta up to Bethel, however, the transition from snow to rain has begun with instrument reports of freezing rain at Bethel Airport. Isolated areas of freezing rain are expected to continue through the evening, with accumulations up to a glaze possible, before transitioning to all rain by late tonight. No major impacts are expected at this time.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
